intro: Cercanthemum anceps, commonly known as the narrowleaf thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, hairy stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in dense clusters, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Cercanthemum anceps is often found in rocky or dry soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
